content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast secretory carcinoma

Management:	12 Apr 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:	Secretory carcinoma, 0.8mm focus, grade 2
	ER/PR/HER2 negative
	NTRK fusion positive
	Sentinel nodes negative (0/2)
	Stage pT1miN0M0

Current Situation:	Post-operative review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following her recent breast surgery. The surgical wounds are healing well with no evidence of infection or seroma. She has good arm movement and no concerning symptoms. Given the sub-millimeter size, node-negative status, and clear margins, the risk of recurrence is considered very low. The presence of NTRK fusion has been confirmed on molecular testing, though given the extremely small tumor size, targeted therapy is not indicated at this stage. We have discussed surveillance plans, including annual mammography. She will be reviewed in the breast clinic in 3 months' time with repeat imaging. She understands to contact us sooner if she develops any new symptoms or concerns.

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
NTRK fusion positive confirmed on molecular testing

patient_facts.value: Surgical wounds healing well with no infection or seroma

status_updates.value: Sub-millimeter NTRK-positive secretory breast carcinoma, node-negative. Post-operative review shows good recovery with very low risk of recurrence.
Review in breast clinic in 3 months with repeat imaging
